channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A ‘Godfather’ of the Internet Says You Should Become a Plumber. Here’s Why
item.description: AI is coming to steal people’s jobs, computing sage Geoffrey Hinton says. Many white-collar workers should be worried sooner than most.

item.title: Amazon Just Announced Its Biggest Prime Day Yet
item.description: The company’s much-anticipated annual sales event will take place in July.

item.title: Why the Danish military is using these crewless vessels in the North and Baltic Seas
item.description: From a distance they look almost like ordinary sailboats, their sails emblazoned with the red-and-white flag of Denmark . But these 10-meter (30-foot)...

item.title: They Sold Their Company for $126 Million. Here’s Their Best Advice for Landing an Exit in 2025
item.description: Don’t become indispensable–and three other pieces of advice from Bryan and Shannon Miles.

item.title: Mubi’s funding backlash reveals a crisis in indie film culture
item.description: Indie streamer Mubi raised a staggering $100 million from Sequoia Capital. Then, fans started boycotting. Mubi built a loyal audience of cinephiles th...

item.title: U.S. retail sales drop in May after a tariff-fueled surge
item.description: U.S. retail sales dropped more than expected in May, weighed down by a decline in motor vehicle purchases as a rush to beat potential tariff-related p...

item.title: Why Kraft Heinz is ditching artificial food dyes — and what’s driving the change
item.description: Kraft Heinz announced on Tuesday their brands will no longer release new products with synthetic or artificial food dyes, and will completely phase th...

item.title: AI won’t cure ‘the infinite workday’ unless companies reengineer work, Microsoft says
item.description: Automating existing processes provides limited gains. Bigger leaps come from new workflows and organizational structures.

item.title: Deloitte is fighting employee burnout with Legos
item.description: Given the rise of mental health woes, financial strain, and concerns over layoffs, there’s a lot weighing on the modern employee . But one company is ...

item.title: Trump Suggests He’ll Extend Deadline for TikTok’s Chinese Owner to Sell App
item.description: If announced, it would be the third time Trump has extended the deadline so that TikTok can keep running.

item.title: Why This Founder Doesn’t Ask New Hires for Resumes
item.description: Genaro Cavazos built one of the fastest-growing security companies in the U.S. with a unique approach to hiring.

item.title: The ‘Godfather of AI’ says this sector will be safe from being replaced by tech—but even then, only the ‘very skilled’ will hold down a job
item.description: Ex-Google AI boss Geoffery Hinton has a stark prediction for workers: Most of you are about to get replaced. Anthropic's and Klarna’s CEOs have issued...

item.title: Ethereum critics say it has failed—but boosters say cryptocurrency has become ‘digital oil’
item.description: The second largest cryptocurrency has lagged behind Bitcoin in price and is still about 50% below all-time highs in 2021.

item.title: Louisiana’s plan to pay college athletes more money? Tax the sports-betting apps
item.description: “Without the athletes, we wouldn’t have the revenue," said Republican state Rep. Neil Riser, who sponsored the bill.

item.title: Arthur Folasa Ah Loo, the 39-year-old killed at the ‘No Kings’ protest, was a Project Runway contestant and designed clothing for ‘Moana 2’
item.description: Ah Loo leaves behind a wife and two young children, according to a GoFundMe page for his family.

A majority of the 10 most American-made cars are now EVs. That’s a first.
